com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.fieldtext

Class Specifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.fieldtext.AbstractFieldText
      • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.fieldtext.Specifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FieldText
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BIAS, BIASVAL, EMPTY, EQUAL, EQUALALL, EXISTS, GREATER, LESS, MATCH, MATCHALL, MATCHRECURSE, NOTEQUAL, NOTMATCH, NOTSTRING, NOTWILD, NRANGE, RANGE, STRING, STRINGALL, WILD

    public class Specifier
extends AbstractFieldText
    A class to represent a general fieldtext specifier of the form: 
    OPERATOR{values}:fields
    In the most general case, the values consist of comma-separated, URL-encoded Strings and the fields are colon-separated Strings. Subclasses may wish to impose further restrictions on the forms of these aspects of the specifier, for example allowing only numeric values. As there is no reliable way to distinguish between colons in XML namespaces and colons in metafields (e.g. autn:date), only namespaces will be escaped automatically. To use a metafield the colon must be escaped to an underscore manually.

    It should not usually be necessary to instantiate this class directly as subclasses exist for all common fieldtext operators. This class and its known subclasses are all immutable but each class provides a number of constructors to make instantiation as convenient as possible.

    • Field Detail

      • OPERATOR

        public final String OPERATOR
        The fieldtext operator for the specifier. It will be in uppercase and interned, allowing == comparison to String literals.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Specifier

        public Specifier(String operator,
                 String field,
                 String... values)
        Creates a new specifier. e.g. 
            new Specifier("OPERATOR", "TITLE", "1 2", "3 4").toString();
        evaluates to: 
            "OPERATOR{1%202,3%204}:TITLE"
        Parameters:
        operator - The fieldtext operator of the specifier.
        field - The name of the IDOL field.
        values - A String... of field values.

      • Specifier

        public Specifier(String operator,
                 String field,
                 Iterable<? extends String> values)
        Creates a new specifier.
        Parameters:
        operator - The fieldtext operator of the specifier.
        field - The name of the IDOL field.
        values - An Iterable of field values.

      • Specifier

        public Specifier(String operator,
                 String[] fields,
                 String... values)
        Creates a new specifier. Colons in field names will be converted to underscores. e.g. 
            new Specifier("OPERATOR", new String[]{"A", "B"}, new String[]{"1 2", "3 4"}).toString();
        evaluates to: 
            "OPERATOR{1%202,3%204}:A:B"
        Parameters:
        operator - The fieldtext operator of the specifier.
        fields - A String[] of field names.
        values - A String... of field values.

      • Specifier

        public Specifier(String operator,
                 String[] fields,
                 Iterable<? extends String> values)
        Creates a new specifier. Colons in field names will be converted to underscores.
        Parameters:
        operator - The fieldtext operator of the specifier.
        fields - A String[] of field names.
        values - An Iterable of field values.

      • Specifier

        public Specifier(String operator,
                 Iterable<? extends String> fields,
                 String... values)
        Creates a new specifier. Colons in field names will be converted to underscores. e.g. 
             List<String> fields = new ArrayList<String>();
     fields.add("A");
     fields.add("B:C");

     new Specifier("OPERATOR", fields, "yes", "no").toString();
        evaluates to: 
            "OPERATOR{yes,no}:A:B_C"
        Parameters:
        operator - The fieldtext operator of the specifier.
        fields - An Iterable of field names.
        values - A String... of field values.

      • Specifier

        public Specifier(String operator,
                 Iterable<? extends String> fields,

        Creates a new specifier. Colons in field names will be converted to underscores.
        Parameters:
        operator - The fieldtext operator for the specifier.
        fields - An Iterable of field names.
        values - An Iterable of field values.

        All specifiers have a size of 1.
        Returns:

      • getOperator

        public final String getOperator()
        Accessor for the OPERATOR field.

        The OPERATOR field.

      • getFields

        public final List<String> getFields()
        Accessor for the list of field names for this specifier. Some specifiers place restrictions on the number of fields they require and may provide more suitable accessors for accessing the field names. As instances are immutable, the returned list does not support modifications.
        Returns:
        The list of field names.

      • getValuesString

        protected String getValuesString()
        Accessor for the specifier's values. The values are URL encoded and separated by commas.
        Returns:
        The specifier's value.

      • getValues

        public final List<String> getValues()
        Accessor for the list of field values for this specifier. An empty value could be signified by either an empty list or a list containing just the empty String - neither the list nor its values should ever be null. As instances are immutable, the returned list does not support modifications.
        Returns:
        A clone of the list of field values.

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        The String representation of the specifier, as it should be sent to IDOL.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        toString in class AbstractFieldText
        Returns:
        An IDOL fieldtext String.
